translated: they separate them from the perceptions of the feeling that arises from the composite of contact through the ear and deliver them from saṃsāra through emptiness.🔽They separate them from the perceptions of the feeling that arises from the composite of contact through the nose and

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate from the discernment of feeling conditioned by sensory contact that is mentally compounded, and they liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.🔽They separate from the discernment of feeling conditioned by sensory contact that is verbally compounded,🔽and they liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /🔽lus kyi 'dus te reg @469a *//
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing / lus kyi 'dus te reg @469a *//
translated: They separate from the discernment of feeling conditioned by sensory contact that is physically compounded,🔽and they liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.🔽They separate from the discernment of feeling conditioned by sensory contact that is mentally compounded,

original: pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: and they liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / sa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / sa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate them from the discernment of the feeling that arises from the condition of the meeting of eye, form, and consciousness, and they liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness.🔽They separate them from the discernment of the earth element,

original: sa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / chu'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /🔽chu'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / me'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / chu'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing / chu'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / me'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: and they liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness. They separate them from the discernment of the water element,🔽and they liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness. They separate them from the discernment of the fire element,

original: me'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / rlung gi khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: me'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / rlung gi khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: and they liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness. They separate them from the discernment of the wind element,🔽and they liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness.

original: rlung gi khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing; nam mkha'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel pa dang /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing; nam mkha'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel pa dang /
translated: They separate them from the perception of the element of wind and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness. They separate them from the perception of the element of space and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /🔽rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / ma rig pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / ma rig pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate them from the perception of the element of consciousness🔽and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness. They separate them from the perception of ignorance🔽and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness. They separate them from the perception of formation

original: ma rig pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis @469b 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / 'du byed kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis @469b 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / 'du byed kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.

original: 'du byed kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes dang phral bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes dang phral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate them from the notion of formative predispositions and liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / ming dang gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /🔽ming dang gzugs kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / skye mched drug gi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / ming dang gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing / ming dang gzugs kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / skye mched drug gi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate them from the notion of consciousness and liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness.🔽They separate them from the notion of name and form and liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness.🔽They separate them from the notion of the six sense fields and liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness.

original: skye mched drug gi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / reg pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / reg pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate them from the notion of contact and liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness.

original: reg pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / tshor ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: reg pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / tshor ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate them from the notion of sensation and liberate them from cyclic existence through emptiness.

original: tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / sred pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: tshor ba'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / sred pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate them from the perception of feeling and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.

original: sred pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / len pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /🔽len pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / srid pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: sred pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / len pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing / len pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / srid pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate them from the perception of craving and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.🔽They separate them from the perception of appropriation and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.🔽They separate them from the perception of becoming and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.

original: srid pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /🔽skye ba'i 'du shes dang @470a *//
analyzed: srid pa'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / skye ba'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing / skye ba'i 'du shes dang @470a *//
translated: They separate them from the perception of birth and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.

original: phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / rga shi'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / rga shi'i 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: They separate them from the perception of aging and death and liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.

original: rga shi'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: rga shi'i 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes dang bral bar byed cing /
translated: and having freed them from the notion of old age and death, they liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.🔽and having freed them from the notion of the compounded element, they liberate them from saṃsāra through emptiness.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings stong pa nyid yin yang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings su 'god pa'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog gi mthur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams kyi 'du shes dang phral nas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor ba las 'grel ba dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings stong pa nyid yin yang 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings su 'god pa'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog gi mthur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and although the element of the uncompounded is emptiness, they do not establish it as the element of the uncompounded.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; de cis stong pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; de cis stong pa lags /
translated: “Lord, by what is it empty?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: 'du shes 'du shes thams cad kyis stong ste /
analyzed: 'du shes 'du shes thams cad kyis stong ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is empty of all notions.

original: rab 'byor / la la zhig gis sprul pa zhig sprul na de la gang stong pa nyid ma yin pa de lta bu'i dngos po gang yang yod dam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor / la la zhig gis sprul pa zhig sprul na de la gang stong pa nyid ma yin pa de lta bu'i dngos po gang yang yod dam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti, if someone were to conjure up an illusory man, would there be anything that is not empty there?”🔽“Lord, there would not be.”

original: de ni / ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni / ma lags so //
translated: “No, Blessed One.”🔽“

original: sprul pa de la gang stong pa nyid ma lags pa de lta bu'i dngos po gang yang ma mchis te /🔽stong pa nyid gang lags pa dang / sprul pa gang lags pa'i chos de gnyis ka'ang ldan pa'ang ma lags /

translated: In that emanation, there is no entity at all that is not emptiness.

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma lags te /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma lags te /

analyzed: de gnyis ka'ang stong pa nyid kyis stong na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: 'gag pa'ang med pa de ni /
translated: and does not cease

original: ma sprul pa'o; ;gsol pa /
analyzed: ma sprul pa'o; ;gsol pa /
translated: is not emanated.”

original: de gang lags /
analyzed: de gang lags /
translated: “What is that?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: mi mnyam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: “Unequalized nirvāṇa.

original: chos de ni /
analyzed: chos de ni /
translated: That phenomenon

original: ma sprul pa'o //
analyzed: ma sprul pa'o //
translated: is not emanated.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis @471b 'di skad du /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis @471b 'di skad du /
translated: “Blessed One, you have said,

original: stong pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la /
translated: ‘They do not waver from emptiness,

original: gnyis su'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gnyis su'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: and they do not observe duality.

original: chos gang yang stong pa nyid ma yin pa de lta bu med do //🔽zhes bka' stsal pa ltar na /
analyzed: chos gang yang stong pa nyid ma yin pa de lta bu med do // zhes bka' stsal pa ltar na /
translated: There is no phenomenon that is not emptiness.’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: mi mnyam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'ang sprul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'ang sprul par 'gyur ro //
translated: unequalized nirvāṇa is also emanated.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena

original: stong pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa ste /
translated: are empty.

original: de dag ni; nyan thos kyis ma byas /
analyzed: de dag ni; nyan thos kyis ma byas /
translated: They are not created by hearers,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
translated: not by the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ma byas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ma byas /
translated: not by the bodhisattva great beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ma mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ma mdzad de /
translated: and not by the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is emptiness of inherent existence

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: is nirvāṇa.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: las dang po pa'i gang zag gis ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid yongs su 'tshal bar bgyi na /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i gang zag gis ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid yongs su 'tshal bar bgyi na /
translated: if a person who is a beginner wants to understand emptiness of inherent existence,

original: ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
translated: how should they be instructed and advised?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / ci sngon dngos po yod par gyur la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / ci sngon dngos po yod par gyur la /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: phyis dngos po med par 'gyur ba yod dam /
analyzed: phyis dngos po med par 'gyur ba yod dam /
translated: “Subhūti, is there something that previously existed and later becomes nonexistent?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la dngos po yong pa'ang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la dngos po yong pa'ang med /
translated: Subhūti, here there is no existent thing,

original: dngos po med pa'ang med /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang med /
translated: there is no nonexistent thing,

original: ngo bo nyid kyang med /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang med /
translated: there is no inherent existence,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po'ang med na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po'ang med na /
translated: and there is no other thing.

original: de la gang yongs su shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba lta yod par 'gyur re skan /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /🔽le'u bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'o ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag @472a *//
analyzed: de la gang yongs su shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba lta yod par 'gyur re skan / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las / le'u bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'o //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag @472a *//
translated: If you ask, What is the emptiness of the essential nature of that which is to be fully known?🔽🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines🔽🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines🔽

original: brgya pa / bam po sum brgya gnyis pa /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhus pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par 'tshal bas /🔽gzugs la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: brgya pa / bam po sum brgya gnyis pa /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhus pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par 'tshal bas /🔽gzugs la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: In that case, is there any such thing as the emptiness that is the very essence of that which is to be thoroughly known?

original: mig gi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: the ear sense source, the nose sense source, the tongue sense source, the body sense source, and the thinking-mind sense source?

original: gzugs kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / ro'i skye mched dang / reg bya'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / ro'i skye mched dang / reg bya'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the form sense source, the sound sense source, the smell sense source, the taste sense source, the tactility sense source, and the dharma sense source?🔽How should they train in the eye constituent, the form constituent, and the eye consciousness constituent,

original: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
translated: the ear constituent, the sound constituent, and the ear consciousness constituent, the nose constituent, the smell constituent, and the nose consciousness constituent,

original: lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la ji ltar @472b bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la ji ltar @472b bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the eye element, the form element, and the eye consciousness element? How should they train in the ear element, the sound element, and the ear consciousness element? How should they train in the nose element, the smell element, and the nose consciousness element? How should they train in the tongue element, the taste element, and the tongue consciousness element? How should they train in the body element, the tangible-object element, and the body consciousness element? How should they train in the thinking-mind element, the dharma element, and the thinking-mind consciousness element?

original: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the sense field of eye contact, and how should they train in the sense fields of ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind contact?

original: ma rig pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in ignorance?

original: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in volitional factors, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, and old age and death?

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the truth of suffering?

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in the truth of the origin, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path?

original: gzugs can gyi chos rnams la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi chos rnams la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should we train in physical phenomena?

original: gzugs can ma lags pa dang / bstan du mchis pa dang / bstan du ma mchis pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa ma mchis pa dang / 'dus bgyis pa dang / 'dus ma bgyis pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs can ma lags pa dang / bstan du mchis pa dang / bstan du ma mchis pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / thogs pa ma mchis pa dang / 'dus bgyis pa dang / 'dus ma bgyis pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: How should we train in non-physical phenomena, visible phenomena, invisible phenomena, impeded phenomena, unimpeded phenomena, conditioned phenomena, unconditioned phenomena, contaminated phenomena,

original: zag pa ma mchis pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba ma mchis pa dang / bsten par bgyi ba dang / bsten par bgyi ba ma lags pa dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa dang /
analyzed: zag pa ma mchis pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba ma mchis pa dang / bsten par bgyi ba dang / bsten par bgyi ba ma lags pa dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa dang /
translated: uncontaminated phenomena, reprehensible phenomena, irreproachable phenomena, phenomena to be practiced, phenomena not to be practiced, inferior phenomena, excellent phenomena,

original: nang dang / phyi dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang /🔽lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa dang / gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang rab @473a *//
analyzed: nang dang / phyi dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa dang / gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa dang / gzugs med pa dang rab @473a *//
translated: internal, external, seen, heard, distinguished, cognized, past, future, present, virtuous, nonvirtuous,🔽indeterminate, associated with the desire realm, associated with the form realm, and associated with the formless realm.

original: tu ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma lags pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: tu ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma lags pa dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: the internal, the external, what is seen, heard, discerned, and cognized, the past, future, and present, the wholesome, the unwholesome, and the neutral, the mundane and supramundane, the conditioned and the unconditioned, the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm, the learner, the non-learner, and the one beyond training, attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, views, and doubt.

original: ser sna dang / sbyin pa dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims bzang po dang / gnod sems dang / bzod pa dang / le lo dang / brtson 'grus dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / bsam gtan dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab dang /
analyzed: ser sna dang / sbyin pa dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims bzang po dang / gnod sems dang / bzod pa dang / le lo dang / brtson 'grus dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / bsam gtan dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab dang /
translated: distraction and concentration,🔽and faulty wisdom and wisdom.

original: shes rab la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should one train in wisdom?🔽How should one train in conceptualization,🔽emptiness,🔽signlessness,🔽aimlessness,🔽unattractive things,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang / log pa'i smon lam dang / smon pa ma mchis pa dang / mi sdug pa'i chos rnams dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang / log pa'i smon lam dang / smon pa ma mchis pa dang / mi sdug pa'i chos rnams dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: impermanence,🔽suffering,

original: bdag med pa rnams la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: bdag med pa rnams la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: and selflessness?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should I train in the afflictions, in the abandonment of the afflictions, in the thoroughly afflicted, in the completely purified, in saṃsāra, in nirvāṇa, in awakening, and in the qualities of a buddha?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Maitreya,

original: byams pa / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par 'dod pas /🔽gzugs @473b ming tsam mo //
analyzed: byams pa / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob par 'dod pas / gzugs @473b ming tsam mo //
translated: “Maitreya, bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom, who wish to train in the bodhisattva trainings,

original: zhes bya bar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in the idea that ‘form is merely a name.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ming tsam mo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ming tsam mo //
translated: They should train in the idea that ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are merely names.’

original: zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du ming tsam mo; ;zhes bya bar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du ming tsam mo; ;zhes bya bar bslab par bya'o //
translated: up to: the dharmas of the Buddha are mere names.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the Bodhisattva Maitreya said this to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!

original: gang gi tshe 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di lta ste /
translated: When this,

original: gzugs zhes bgyi ba'i ming 'di dngos po dang bcas par dmigs /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bgyi ba'i ming 'di dngos po dang bcas par dmigs /
translated: namely, the name ‘form’ is apprehended as having a real basis,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: this,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bgyi ba'i ming 'di dngos po dang bcas par dmigs pa nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bgyi ba'i ming 'di dngos po dang bcas par dmigs pa nas 'di lta ste /
translated: namely, the name ‘feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness’ is apprehended as having a real basis, up to:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bgyi ba'i bar gyi ming 'di ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bgyi ba'i bar gyi ming 'di ni /
translated: this, namely, the name ‘dharmas of the Buddha’

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma nye bar bzung ste dngos po dang bcas par dmigs pa lags na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan ma nye bar bzung ste dngos po dang bcas par dmigs pa lags na /
translated: is apprehended as having a real basis, having taken up the sign of a compounded thing,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpas gzugs ming tsam zhes bgyi bar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpas gzugs ming tsam zhes bgyi bar bslab par bgyi /
translated: how should a Bodhisattva be trained in the idea that ‘form is mere name’?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ming tsam zhes bgyi ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du ming tsam zhes bgyi bar ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ming tsam zhes bgyi ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du ming tsam zhes bgyi bar ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: “How should we train in the fact that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are merely names, and so forth, up to the fact that the qualities of the Buddha are merely names?

original: dngos po ma mchis lags na /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis lags na /
translated: If they are not things,

original: de'i ming de'ang ming tsam kho na zhes bgyir mi rung lags te /
analyzed: de'i ming de'ang ming tsam kho na zhes bgyir mi rung lags te /
translated: then it is not appropriate to say that their names are merely names.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gzugs zhes bgyi ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bgyi ba ni /
translated: ‘Form’

original: ming tsam kho na zhes bgyir mi rung lags so //
analyzed: ming tsam kho na zhes bgyir mi rung lags so //
translated: is not appropriate to say that it is merely a name.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:
